Events and trends
* 865 BCâKar Kalmaneser (also known as Tell Ahmar and Til Barsib), an
  independent Neo-Hittite kingdom located in current Syria on the banks of the
  Euphrates River, is conquered by the Assyrian king Ashurnasirpal II.
* 864 BCâDiognetus, King of Athens, dies after a reign of 28 years (beginning
  892 BC), and is succeeded by his son Pherecles.
* 860 BCâThe kingdom of Urartu (currently Armenia is unified.
